human
Class Human_joints.HumanPart

java.lang.Object
  human.Human_joints.HumanPart
Enclosing class:
Human_joints
 class Human_joints.HumanPart
extends java.lang.Object

This is class for each human part . It will have different parameters and fucntions required to move or rotate

Human_joints.HumanPart

public Human_joints.HumanPart(java.lang.String Part_name,
                              TransformGroup temp,
                              Vector3d position)
Constructor for HumanPart Class

Parameters:
Part_name - name of the part
temp - Transformation group that represents the part
position - position of that part . This position is necessary later for doing roation and transformation
Method Detail

set_transformGroup

public void set_transformGroup(TransformGroup temp)
set the transfromgroup to the current part of the body

Parameters:
temp - Transformation group to be set

set_translation_speed

public void set_translation_speed(Vector3d trans_speed)
This function is used to set the translation speed

Parameters:
trans_speed - trans_speed.x is the translation speed in x_direction; trans_speed.y is the translation speed in y_direction trans_speed.z is the translation speed in z_direction

set_joint_position

public void set_joint_position(Vector3d position)
this will sets for the current part what is the joint positon

Parameters:
position - position of the joint with respect to the position of current_part

rotate

public void rotate(double deg,
                   int axis)
This function is used to rotate the current human part about particular axis

Parameters:
deg - amount of rotation in degrees
axis - rotation about which axis . if axis=0 means rotation about x-axis. if axis=1 means rotation about y-axis. if axis=2 means rotation about z-axis .

rotate_about_multiple_axis

public void rotate_about_multiple_axis(Vector3d rotate)
This function is used to rotate the current part about multiple axis

Parameters:
rotate - rotate.x is the amount of rotation you want about X-axis . rotate.y is the amount of rotation you want about Y-axis . rotate.z is the amount of rotation you want about Z-axis

set_transform

public void set_transform(Vector3d displacement)
this function is used to displace[translate] the part from one position to another positon .

Parameters:
displacement - It is the new position that you want to translate current part

public void calculate_torsion()

set_to_intial

public void set_to_intial(double x_rot,
                          double y_rot,
                          double z_rot)
After rotating if you want make the current_body_part to come to its intail state by rotating you can use this function

Parameters:
x_rot - double x_rotation in degrees
y_rot - double x_rotation in degrees
z_rot - double x_rotation in degrees

set_part_current_rotation

public void set_part_current_rotation(Vector3d rotate)
This function is used to change the current rotation of the part

Parameters:
rotate - new rotation that you want to set

rotate_multiple_axis

public void rotate_multiple_axis(Vector3d rot_start,
                                 Vector3d rot_end)
This function is used to rotate the part , from particular start angle to end angle incrementally each time you call this function

Parameters:
rot_start - start angles [ rot_start.x is the start angle about x axis , similarly for other axes ]
rot_end - End angle [ rot_end.x is the end angle about x axis , similarly for other axes ]

move

public void move(Vector3d start,
                 Vector3d end)
This function is used to Translate the part , from particular start position to end position incrementally each time you call this function

Parameters:
start - starting position [ start.x is the position x co-ordinate , similarly for other co-ordinates]
end - Ending position [ end.x is the position x co-ordinate , similarly for other co-ordinates]
